description: Begins with a note from Belle Hawkes' relative: "Miscellaneous items found with Aunt Belle's diaries - plans of some house - Persia? Wit and humor - a fascinating collection." Includes unspecified building plans, paintings that Belle Hawkes created for her sister, Margaret, and a collection of jokes and humorous stories.

creator: Hawkes, Belle, 1854-1919|Speer, Robert E. (Robert Elliott), 1867-1947|Hawkes, James W.|Bailey, LeRoy, 1946-

subject: Hawkes, Belle, 1854-1919|Sherwood, Margaret Pollock, 1864-1955|Hale, Ralph T. (Ralph Tracy), 1880-|Harper, Jean|Harper, Francis|Cowles, A. (Robert Elliott), 1867-1947|Elmira College|Women missionaries--Iran|Missionaries--Iran|Iran|Manuscripts|Archives|Correspondence|Biographies
description: Belle Hawkes biographical data as provided by some of her loved ones. Includes: a letter written by Robert Speer addressed to Belle Hawkes' sister, Margaret; "Belle Sherwood Hawkes - Thirty-Six Years in Persia," a 1931 essay written her husband, James W. Hawkes for the Elmira College Alumnae News; an excerpt from a 1969 letter from LeRoy Bailey, the nephew of Belle, to Jane and Francis Harper. Also includes Belle Hawkes' "Circular Letter to Expected Students," for Elmira College, 1871.

description: [Text transcribed from caption] Property of Belle and Jim, Persia. Prince 57' 12 in. high. Peter 55' 12 in. high. In the no. Persian wild ass (the presumptive progenitor of the animal in the photograph), a male's height at the shoulder is given as 50 in., a female's as 44 in. Extinct and vanishing mammals of the Old World. Perhaps the measurement given on the back of the photographs, the original of which belonged to Mrs. Hawkes, applied to the distance from the top of the head to the ground. F.H. 4-16-70. (Francis Harper.)
